Once I had a pour-over so good it knocked me straight back into 1977 where I accidentally prevented my parents form meeting and ceased to exist in a singular moment of glory. I don't even know how I'm writing this.

But seriously: This place oozes über-nerd nostalgia without being remotely pretentious and has some of the best coffee you'll find in Chicago (or, for that matter, anywhere). Every single barista on staff can pull you a shot that is guaranteed to curl your toes with delight, and when you're done cogitating on your imbibitions, you can set yourself down to read, work, or play in one of the comfiest coffee shops around.

Yes, have some.

I love this place! Unfortunately I don't live in Chicago so I can't come here more frequently. If I did though, I would probably visit this place at least a few times a week. My drink was excellent and I love that they make their syrups in house!
Staff is lovely - coffee is great and the Delorean is fun!

i have seen hipster central, and it is the wormhole.

I stopped in looking for a place to get some work done and the delorian called to me. Like others said, they have a great 80s theme going. They also have tons of comfy couches and tables of all sizes to set up a nice work station.

I did immediately notice I may have been one of a few people there not working on some sweet creative writing piece or reading an obscure book of poetry picked up from myopic, but i kinda liked that. there's something fun about being surrounded by tight pants, thick-rimmed glasses and of course, the occasional mowhawk. maybe that's just me.

Now for the reason i gave 3 stars instead of 4 or 5. I take my coffee black, so i cannot comment on the peanut butter whatchamacallits, but i thought the coffee was just okay. not bad, but nothing fantastic. Also, the wifi kept going out while I was there, and the staff had to keep restarting it, but I realize this may not happen every day.

so there you have it. overall, a comfy place to stop for some coffee and get work done if you're in the area.

My high-maintenance soy latte was made to perfection....Even with a heart!
The place is so cool, yet cozy.  I honestly didn't want to leave.
Hoping they're open tomorrow (Easter Sunday) so I can chill out on one of those comfy couches.

Wormhole makes me upset that I live on the opposite side of Chicago.

I have yet to find something I don't like about this place...the atmosphere is top-notch (you can't ignore the BttF DeLorean and the Star Wars miniatures), the coffee is excellent, and the staff is great. I'm a big fan of their mocha, which is served in what I believe are some of the most reasonable portions at any coffeehouse. Sure, the cups are small, but the quality is good enough that it really doesn't matter.

The baristas are really friendly, and not just in the "I'm-angling-for-a-tip." They seem genuinely happy to be there, and are serious about what they do. It's a nice change of pace, especially for a coffee shop.

I just moved here and was looking up places to go around my apartment and I have to say..this place definitely lives up to all of the hype on here...the inside is pretty amazing, especially the Delorean.. I went on a mission to try the Peanut Butter Koopa Troopa and I LOVED it!!! I'm sure I will be spending a lot of money on that delicious drink as long as I live in Wicker Park.

I love this place!

Great atmosphere, plenty of space, AMAZING coffee.  Only reason for 4 stars is the small selection for pastries and other edibles.

awesomeeeee.

even though i moved out of the neighborhood into roscoe, i still journey to wormhole for the times when i wanna go to a coffee shop to chill out, read, or do some work. and its surrounded by retail shops so after, i can spend the tiny amount of extra (and lets face it, its rare) money i have on clothes or whatnot.

its not big by any means but its not small, good coffee shop size. and yes, it gets packed.

all drinks are created super legit. coffee is made like how it should. mocha latte is my usual. teas are great too!

wifi works all the time. even when everyone is on it.

they take paper and plastic. i highly recommend it.

I stumbled upon this place during wicker park fest. It was a wonderful find!
I got the iced coffee, which was decently priced, under 3 bucks.
The atmosphere is really cool too, decorating with a bunch of toys and lunchboxes from the 80s.
Highly recommend!

Went for the first time last night and loved it. Okay...I looked a little "mature" at 42 being there with my son who is moving into the area, but no one stared, everyone was friendly and the drinks were delicious. So much fun stuff to look at there and super relaxed and cozy. I look forward to returning.

No doubt one of the better and finer coffee joints on Milwaukee ave... Their coffee is super awesome and fresh... I love the delorian they have... They have a nice patio area... The place is a tad bit tiny and always packed which is the only reason I gave em 4 stars... The staff is super cool and so are the people that stop by... I actually spent an entire day working on my computer here and really enjoyed the coffee and cookies they had. Great place to hang out get work done or just grab an amazing Cup of coffee.

I say hell yeah to wormhole coffee. The employee's were always friendly and the coffee is great. The coffee is as great as the best places in San Francisco, DC and New York and better than many in those cities. They offer pour over cups but I found the affordable drip coffee to be sufficiently strong and delicious. Lots of seating space too. More affordable than Intelligentsia.

So yeah this place rocks the old school way, and the Delorean earns them a full five stars even before I tasted my iced coffee

So we went to the Wicker Park Music Fest today, and along the way we saw the Worm Hole and I am not one to pass up a independent coffee shop with out sampling, but when I saw the car in the window I was like WTF? the have a Delorean in the shop we must go in

then there is all the other old school stuff like lunch boxes, and bobble heads, copies of Mad Magazine, then there is the chairs that have been upholstered with coffee sacks how fucking cool is that ?

the place just has a great vibe and people were have a good time being here, pr just relaxed and enjoying a book and coffee or a friends conversation

and the Iced Coffee I got was nice and smooth not acidic at all it was just right, I will be back to try more, and my partners Latte was really good he said

I am going to go on and say the hipster thing
"I liked wormhole coffee before it was cool" haha
I've been going here for couple of years and they've been just great.
I still go back from time to time but there are mobs of people sometimes

I went to the Wormhole for the first time this evening. It was pretty hopping for a Sunday night, probably since it is Labor Day weekend. I had my usual summer coffee shop drink an iced chai and it was pretty good. There were only a few not so tempting looking pastries left and I assume the delicious ones had already been devoured by customers earlier in the day.

I liked that the subtle 80s/90s theme they had going on. It wasn't too over the top or obnoxious looking. They also had a few drinks with interesting names such as the Koopa Troopa. The pearler bead coasters were a nice touch too. Additionally, they had plenty of seating options both inside and outside.

One thing I was not a fan of, however, was the smell & the large coffee pots being up at the bar. I'm sure the smell was stronger by them than in other parts of the shop and I could've done without the stray coffee grinds on the counter near my textbook.

Overall, it was a good experience and I plan on going back especially on late nights since they're often open later than most coffee shops.

All in all a pretty great little cafe. I wish my apartment looked like this -- the decor is lovely. There's also DeLorean in the front. Don't ask me how a cafe in Wicker Park affords that.

I had the citrus latte, which was good. The barista was very pleasant and even offered to make me a new one when I hadn't drank mine quick enough (slow coffee drinker). So, in short, great service and a nice, relaxed atmosphere where one can work. And it's open later than anything else I found, so I'll definitely be heading back here when I need a late-night cafe.
This place is so neat... Enjoyed the coffee a lot and who doesn't love a delorean display?!?

The coffee was overall pretty good but the cups were pretty small. Also make sure you look closely at the menu because for some drinks you can't get them to go. The atmosphere was great and its always crowded so try to get there at a not lunch/dinner hour. The back to the future car was amazing !

I work right down the street from this place and my co-worker had a simple cup of coffee from here to which she exclaimed to all of us, "Oh my God you guys, taste this! It's delicious!"

The small coffees are kind of small, but the flavor is robust and the coffee is strong so there really is no need for a bigger cup. (I'd probably go nuts from too much caffeine in a bigger size anyway, being sensitive to caffeine.)

I'm pretty sure all the coffees they're brewing are Metropolis coffees  which is a made-in-Chicago coffee brand, so you're really supporting local Chicagoans by coming here.

And I am THRILLED to see that they have jasmine pearls tea here! It's quite hard to get a cup of jasmine tea seemingly anywhere except maybe Argo Tea - and if most places have jasmine tea, it's jasmine aroma mixed with green tea. But not here! This jasmine tea is the real deal!

Everyone here was very nice and friendly too. It seems like a nice and quiet place to study/relax/work on small art projects and less crowded than the other cafe alternative down the street. I'm sure that will change with time though.

I'll definitely be going through the menu and trying everything here, especially since I have to walk past it every day.

Welcome, The Wormhole!

This place is AWESOME! I recommend trying "The Walter Peck" - coolest and tastiest non-alcoholic shot you'll ever have. First time I went in I tried the Walter Peck and then had an iced coffee to sip on - no sugar or milk/creamer needed it was so good.

The staff is very friendly and the decor is wonderfully unique 80s paraphernalia. Best part though is the Delorean - straight out of Back to the Future and equipped with a Flux capacitor -  in the front window - too cool!

This place has amazing coffee and not to mention the baristas really know what they are doing and can do some beautiful latte art. I have never actually hung out here but I love stopping in and grabbing a coffee to go!

Great coffee, my new favorite in Chicago ... awesome baristas ... and decor that makes me feel like I'm sleeping in bunk beds and having GI Joe vs Transformers battles in my sandbox again.

My favorite thing so far exclusive to this place is the Cascara Tea (coffee cherry husks) ... delish!

Also really roomy and clean ... great retro furniture ... kind of brings back to life what was cool about coffee shops 10 or 15 years ago!

This is one of the only reviews I'll ever write where I wish I could give the establishment zero stars.

This is the worst coffee shop I have been to in Chicago. When I went in, I ordered a dirty chai with an extra shot. The barista informed me that their shots are already doubles and incredulously asked me if i "really wanted more than that." I did. I was tired, hungover, and had to go see my family. I needed caffeine, and caffeine without judgment.

She rings me out, then turns around to the other barista, while I'm still putting the change back in my wallet and says "There is nothing I'd like to be doing less right now than making this girl's (finger quotes) "latte". Then proceeded to talk about how it was hard enough to make one shot in their machine, let alone two for just one drink.

Before she even started making it, a friend of hers came in and she talked to them for five minutes while orders backed up. It took over 10 minutes to get my coffee, all the while she was bitching about having to make it.

I will never go back, and I tell everyone I know to avoid it when there are other places in Wicker Park that make coffee without being snobby, slow, and rude.

I totally love this place! FREE Wi-Fi! The ambiance is so chill and i love the 80's theme. I'm a child of the 80's and so want to steal the ALF lunch box off they're wall. :P

The staff is friendly, plenty of room to sit and good location.  Dare I say...excellent coffee!!!  I don't know if it's possible to crave going to a coffee joint but I crave this place.
 
Each time I've been here I notice something cool on their walls or decor. Like the Atari cartriges I found on my way to the restroom.  :D Definitely a good place to chill, sip on some freshly brewed coffee and enjoy being warped back in time.

Oh, so THIS is where all the hot hipster guys hang out in Wicker Park.

I see.

I like.

I will come back.

And not just for the coffee.  Which was delicious, BTW.

Come for the DeLorean, stay for the coffee!  

For starters, you will be hard pressed to find a cafe more adamant about maintaining its particular aesthetic.  For instance, if you ask about the level of detail considered while ornamenting the DeLorean to look like the time machine from Back to the Future, the response will be, "Well that depends which movie you are talking about.  The car changes between the movies and we have done our best to reproduce the look of the car at the very end of the first movie."  Fair enough.  This nerdy attention to detail and aesthetic resonates not only in the decor but also in the coffee.

In regards to the drinks you will have a myriad of options of traditional favorites as well as a few of their very own custom creations.  The ingredients are often top notch and you will see a good amount of better than fair trade aromatic beans to choose from.  

Wifi is free as is the general jovial attitude of the waitstaff.  The social flavor is a lot more friendly and inviting compared to some of the more trendy hipster cafes in the area.  

Two complains.  As this coffeehouse gains in popularity seating options decrease so you would do well to get in early and plant yourself if you need to sit.  The other complaint.  WHERE IS MY 1.21 GIGAWATTS STICKER!

Great place. The coffee is delicious and the atmosphere is cozy. I really enjoyed playing the nintendo while sipping on my "Drunken Citrus Mocha". It's a great place to hangout at with friends or just to surf on the internet.
ps: There is a high concentration of hipsters. BEWARE! jk

Best decor ever. And I'm not just saying that as a die-hard fan of everything 80s. Okay, I am just saying it as a die-hard 80s fan. But still, you can't deny it's pretty great. Movie posters on the wall, nostalgic toys and technology strewn throughout, and old mac se, castle greyskull, cartoon lunchboxes, the millennium falcon, and of course the full size delorean in the front window that brought me into this place in the first place.

I guess I should mention the coffee, since it is actually a coffee shop. It's great quality coffee, although a bit lacking in the dessert drinks for me. But they have all the standards, and they make a pretty good peanut butter latte.

Oh and in the back, there's an old tv with a sega and an NES hooked up to it. With like 40 NES games. Seriously, that is awesome. If I lived in the neighborhood I would probably park myself at this place every night and just chill among all the trappings of my childhood.

A cool friendly coffee house with an 80s theme.

The Wormhole is a place that most people discover by accident when they see a full sized Delorian in the window as they walk down Milwaukee in the Heart of Wicker Park.   Given the poor signage on the place which until recently didn't even have a sidewalk chalkboard announcing its presence.

However for those of us that just happened to notice the Delorian were in for a treat and a time warp.   Filled with 80s era pop culture decor like Calvin and Hobbes posters in the bathrooms, several 80s videogame systems such as the NES on a vintage TV, and figurines and posters of all sorts of our (late 20s/ early 30-somethings) childhood memories in the main room, this place oozes with a geeky/hipstery nostalgic character.

The Coffee is Metropolis, which is good, but as I mentioned before, overused in Chicago independent coffeehouses.  Despite the overused coffee there are some nice twists here such as cereal and a very large "T"ea list that one could pity the fool for never noticing it posted right by the counter.

The most impressive offering however are the tea/coffee cereal mixes, Mocha Puffs is an unbelievable combination of sugar (Coca Puffs) and caffeine (Mocha) guaranteed to send you into a drunken sugar rush ala Bart and Milhouse when they ordered the "All Syrup Super Squishy Bender" from the Simpsons (yes its a 90s reference, but totally appropriate here).  Also available is a delicious but not as insomnia inducing Chaireeos, which is chai latte mixed with Cheerios.

Its also open later than other Coffee Spots in Wicker Park.  This isn't saying much as it still closes at Midnight on Saturdays, but  its hard to find these kinds of places in Chicago (see my other reviews).  Another nice thing is that the bartistas aren't assholes about chasing you way before closing time (see the Iguana Cafe) and will let you slowly make your way to the door, which is appropriate for a chill place like a cafe.

The video game systems are fun if you can reserve a spot.  There are also old board games and vintage trivial pursuit.  The book selection is cool in a geeky sort of way too including a book with video game inspired poetry.

All in all a good place, if you can actually find it.  Look for the Delorian and step back into your childhood memories.  This place would be perfect if it had a liquor license and was open a tad later.

top 10 reasons coming to "the Wormhole" should be a mandated rite of passage (nostalgic purposes for any peeps born before the 90's and historical thereafter):

1) remarkably brilliant seasonal drinks paired with witty names grace their menu - such as "The McCallister" for December is a cascara (a different part of the coffee plant steeped like tea) and "Tomahawk" for November is a maple syrup infused green tea latte with a sugar dipped rim

2) they managed to squeeze the back to the future DELOREAN through the door for a window display - nearly equivalent to building a miniature ship in a bottle... BRAVO

3) on top a reclaimed cathode-ray-tube TV (because LCD or plasma would be down right inappropriate) is a working NINTENDO system.... with a good assortment of games... if you can nab a spot on the sectional couch you can finally show off in a modern time where you feel shameful that people a third of your age make you feel as coordinated as a cow any instance you chance HALO and opt rather to get lost in 8 bits for a shameless 80 minutes of immortality...

4) WARNING: the food and drinks are made and correspondingly named with such care it could make you feel like a bad parent if you conceived your child in a Dodge Ram and named her Mercedes.... they have a turkey sammich named "Scott Pilgrim" (haven't tried) but i tried the "Honeybear Blossom Latte" and "Peanut Butter Koopa Troopa" both of which had beautifully embellished foam to make you feel guilty devouring it within ten minutes like a gleeful glutton

5) teenage mutant ninjas turtles, ghostbusters, star wars, back to the future, indiana jones, the goonies, gremlins, classic lunch boxes, breakfast club, BILL COSBY.... i almost cried remembering my glorious childhood... i remember the days i had the liberty to play Mario Brothers and Zelda (2D style) from start to finish within a full day, wake up at 5 AM only to religiously eat cereal while watching Captain Planet and Transformers then promptly go right back to bed afterwards, or watch either "Don't Tell Mom The Babysitter's Dead", "Beetlejuice", or "Flight of the Navigator" (even though they all somehow somewhat scared the life out of me) about 3 times a week without having to worry about paying bills, cooking dinner, or sleeping by 8PM against my will

6) the staff seems sooo genuinely passionate and content it makes you question why you slave 8 hours of your day in the dilapidated slums of Gary, Indiana... better yet the meaning of life... contrary to the large corporate coffee competitors out there these employees don't seem to be nice because there is a manager holding a gun to their back or suspending them for not permanently smiling at work

7) for validating my once tremendous fear of ET has been truly conquered... i am serious... i couldn't sleep for months and had night terrors about ET... i cried just passing a room full of people watching it.... i couldnt even look at ET plush dolls without crying... until i finally killed ET within a nightmare turned dream... (my psychiatrist says this is totally normal so no worries! promise!)... i came face to face once again with an ET plush doll here some 20 years later from that dark time and needless to say i had the last laugh... THANK YOU WORMHOLE

8) i got to geek out openly at nerdtastic blueprints and miniature models of movie spacecraft or vehicles... i nearly squealed when i saw the definition of wormhole put on the door... the only thing missing was Morgan Freeman narrating dark matter or black holes on the audio... id even compromise with just Hans Zimmer

9) I NOTICED they have chairs upholstered with imported coffee burlaps... witty, sustainable, creative

10) HERE is the kitsch coffee mugs i once called mine as a child but since has been either tossed, dispersed into the world via garage sales, or donated to the needy... heartlessly torn from my life... but wormhole was Romeo to my Juliet (the before they went squirrelly part) and i was able to find my love again after ours lives were separated from dissension and misunderstanding

a damned good iced latte.  Damned good.
Maybe not the best place to try to get work done, because the music is loud and a bit raucous, and it's very busy.  I did more people watching than actual work.  The lighting is also not ideal for working.
But it's definitely a fun place to hang out, in a fun neighborhood, and mmm, that latte...

I'm a fan of exploring and I'm a fan of independent coffeeshops. So I go to a lot of different places in search of excellent coffee and a good vibe. I've only been in Chicago for about four months, but I've been to dozens of places and Wormhole is BY FAR the best coffeeshop I've come across in this city.

First off, the staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable. I can ask them any question and they're not only happy to give me an answer, they're actually excited about their products. They know everything that comes through there is top of the line, and the pride in what they are serving comes across in their demeanor.

Speaking of what they're serving, it's incredible. Just the other day I tried cascara, a tea made of unroasted coffee bean husks. I was not expecting how fantastic (and apricot-like) the tea would be. Their coffees are excellent, I appreciate the fact they're always bringing in guest beans as well. They've got some tasty vegan baked goods there as well.

And then, there's the atmosphere. You kinda can't describe Wormhole without the decor, which is full of 80s memorabilia. This can be hard to pull off, but the kicker is that Wormhole *does* pull it off. From the Delorean (yes, a full size car) in the window to the Bill Cosby poster and Star Wars memorabilia to the playable Nintendo setup in the back, the decor stays whimsical while being classy about it.

This is definitely a destination 5-star coffee shop. Some coffeeshops get 5 stars because the people in the neighborhood want to compliment the local establishment, and you kinda scratch your head when you get there. No, this is an honest to goodness get your butt over here if you like coffee place.

The coffee here is truly amazing.  It's really that simple.  Easily the best coffee in the neighborhood.  It tastes so good i really don't care what else is in the shop (a car, hipsters on computers, whatever).

My one complaint is that 16 oz is their biggest size for a coffee, and that leaves me a bit of a caffeine deficit in the afternoon...but maybe, if there was a way to time travel so that i could leave work and get coffee, and be back so fast it was like i never left, i could just get more coffee....something like a time travelling car....or a...wormhole...

MY friend Henry brought me here first, and over the summer it really grew on me. This place is my absolute favorite coffee shop in Chicago. I really have no changes or improvements to advise.
The coffee is outstanding, the different types of beverages and teas they have are all very hip and fun; its interior is impeccably nostalgic, and there are power outlets everywhere for people to work on their laptops.
It also attracts some of the most attractive and well-dressed people I've ever seen in Chicago, along with the sexiest baristas I've ever had the pleasure of meeting.

There's definitely a high attention to detail here but the single origin espresso I got here wasn't good at all. Also the shot was way smaller than it should have been. I'm
definitely going to try their pour over but as of now I'm only giving it three stars.

A paragon of trendy retro-hipsterdom, staffed by baristas who weren't born when the cartoon lunchboxes, action figures, and other '80s memorabilia on its shelves were in their prime...

But seriously, I might donate a lesser organ for their Citrus Mocha.  Dark chocolate, coffee, & Grand Marnier?!  I'm just angry I didn't think of it first.

And for hipsters, the staffers are surprisingly helpful and friendly...

First and foremost:  They have great coffee.  I live down by Chicago and Damen  and have 3 coffee places within 2 blocks of me.  I pass about 3 more on my mile walk down to wormhole to get a coffee because their coffee is SO MUCH BETTER.

And their baristas will make your drink well and they make it like you like it (unlike certain other places with great coffee who now have issues following customer requests).

So I love wormhole.  The 80s stuff is a stupid mess, but whatever.  I guess the kids like it.

coffee/ drinks are really good but this play is always wayyyyy to fucking crowded for its own good. want to sit and enjoy your coffee or get some reading done? forget it. you cant do that here. too many unemployed dirty hipsters crashing on the couches 24/7

grab your amazing drink and run.

P.s. Ive been going to Wormhole at least once a week for the past 4 years. I really do like the coffee

Come to WH immediately. Or, on second thought, don't, because you'll probably take my spot and then I'll have to go somewhere else.

The coffee is delicious, best chai latte I've had in Chicago, and they have a wide variety of fun stuff on the menu (dying to try the "mocha puffs.")

The decor is retro awesome and the staff is super nice. I got a free (and insanely delicious) chai macaroon with my medium chai latte just because they felt like giving me one. How kickass is that?

This place is the best.

As everyone else has stated, the koopa troopa was amazingly delicious. The atmosphere is chill, if you can get a seat.  I can on a Satruday evening (around 5pm) and the place was packed with patrons.  If you can get a spot by the NES that is the way to go.  I am hoping that next time I go I'll be able to play!  Love going here because I love thinking of my childhood of the early 1980's.
great place to hide out and get comfortable for an afternoon of studying with a honey bear latte
Love this place! Try the Honey Bear Latte.   Be prepared to share your coffee talk with strangers ... It's always packed with limited intimate seating.

Prompt, delicious, pretty coffee. Geek memorabilia galore, very 80's and the chairs are so cozy!
And the bathroom is clean. Yay!
This place is great.  The skinny jean wearing staff is very nice and the drinks are good.  Was glad I stopped in.

Right on Mike D.  The people at Wormhole have never been anything but awesome every time Ive been in there.  I applaud the owner for standing up against the the type of people that have made yelp useless at this point, cowards who instead of voicing their complaint face to face with a business owner will go and hide behind their online review account.  USELESS.  Wormhole has some of the friendliest people in coffee.

Walking down the street searching for a hot cup of joe, i spot a DeLoren in a shop window.  What the heck?   But of course I had to investigate.  Its a coffee shop?!! Perfect.   Upon further exploration, I thought i must still be sleeping and this is only a dream....people were playing Contra on an original NES and sipping coffee drinks named after video game characters.   Rad.   While waiting for my drink, somehow an extra got made so the Barista gave it to me.  Score!    I'm a fan for life.

Wormhole is definitely an A+! I just recently made my first visit to this 80's/future-inspired coffee shop, and I'm so glad I did! I went with an Iced Chai, and it was seriously amazing. Not too milky, not too spicy, just right. I loved that they served it in a glass without a straw rather than putting it in a to-go cup Starbucks-style. I felt like I was at home! The baristas were so nice, too. Did I mention the DeLorean is there? Umm, yeah, this place is THAT awesome. I can't wait to go back!

The decor in this cafe will put you back into the 80's/90's. Super friendly staff with tasty snacks and perfectly made drinks. If you need to get your home work done this is definitely the place to go.
Great coffee, great atmosphere and some fun video games. Free wifi. Plenty of comfy places to sit. If I lived in chicago I would definetly be a regular.

no exaggeration - best lattes of our lives. trust us and try the homemade vanilla latte and you won't be disappointed. it's definitely on the sweet side, but with amazing fresh vanilla bean flavor on top of great strong espresso, it's an awesome combo. The staff was super friendly and the atmosphere was cool - plenty of space to sit, ready, work, chill. Will definitely be back!

Quality is the only word I can describe this place as. Recently I met with one of the owners and had a great conversation with him. I asked him where he finds his barista's, I casually said, "Starbucks"?  He looked at me and grined. He said, when I have an opening I seek out my staff. If I took out a help wanted ad, I would get every Starbucks employee who has been called a master barista. He went on to say that new associates must make a variety of drinks and have them evaluated in house. This was great to hear that this place takes thier product so seriously. Aside from the remarks already made, the environment is very welcoming, the snacks are great, and the staff really take the time out of their day to welcome you and make you feel at home.

Best coffee and chocolate croissants in the city AND the staff is amazing.  They are friendly and efficient and they look really cool :  )  I bet the owner is awesome because the employees seem to genuinely care about the place

I came to Wormhole a handful of times in 2011, but always had a disconcerting experience. The coffee was amazing...but the baristas made me feel unwelcome in a way that I couldn't quite figure out, so I chose to go to other places.

More recently, one of my friends started frequenting Wormhole and claimed that they had the best iced vanilla lattes he's ever had. That's quite a claim and I'm not one to rely on someone else's opinion for that. I had to verify this for myself.

So I went last week in the morning with said friend and got not only iced lattes but a blueberry muffin and a berry corn muffin. I watched the barista make the drink and honestly have never seen an iced latte made like that, with the addition of foam. I had asked for light ice and the barista explained to me that she could do that but that it wouldn't taste right because they have a specific ratio of ingredients that would be thrown off. I appreciated her taking the time to provide an explanation for why it wouldn't be a good idea. So I chose not to get the light ice then. And I am super happy that I didn't. That was one amazing latte! They really do have it down to an exact science. Not too sweet, a good amount of espresso flavor and nice and icy; perfect for enjoying on their outdoor tables in the sunshine. I also very much appreciate the use of real glasses for the iced lattes because a lot of other places give you plastic cups and don't have recycling or compost bins. As for the muffins, the blueberry was a solid blueberry muffin, not particularly special but exactly what you would want when you ask for a blueberry muffin. Yum. The berry corn muffin ended up not having any berries in it! My friend took it back inside to see what had happened and came back outside with a berry version and plate of vegan oreos! How incredibly nice!! The berry corn muffin was amazing. Simple but different enough from the usual muffins that I get that it made me want to eat more of them! When we went back in to drop off the dishes, I made sure to talk to one of the guys that had helped us with unlocking the outdoor furniture to let him that the iced latte was perfection. The staff was definitely much kinder and friendlier than I had experienced before at Wormhole. That was a welcome change and it makes for an experience that I would like to repeat.

I will be back for an iced vanilla latte. And maybe a berry corn muffin...or two.

I really like this place.  The atmosphere (the cool 80s kitsch, the comfy sofas and chairs, the dimmed lighting), friendly/enthusiastic staff, and free wifi make it a really cool place to hang out.  I mean, seriously, who doesn't love the DeLorean in front?  

Just as importantly, the coffee's wonderful.  I tend towards iced mochas and the like (yeah, I know, sue me).  The baristas put a lot of work into the drinks, and it shows.  And while the food offerings had initially been kinda weak, they've expanded on them quite a bit in recent weeks.  Overall, awesome.

Living only a block away, I feel as though I am always here. The coffee is fantastic (metropolis, I think), and their vanilla bean latte is literally the best latte I've ever had. The vegan pastry items are also pretty darn good.

The only downside is that this place is always packed. Now I know thats not Wormhole's fault (unless we want to blame it on their awesome-ness), but sometimes the place is jam-packed and the only place to sit is at a tiny table with 4 other people.

The espresso and teas are great.  The wireless is free and unrestricted.  The crowd is mellow and nerdy.  Laptops abound.  The music is varied and good.  Someone should write a song about the peach-and-berry pie.
These folks make some REALLY good coffee drinks.  I also had a cupcake there, and it was probably the best I have ever had...and it was vegan!  I don;t know how they did it, but it was amazing.

Great concept, very identifiable with the neighborhood.  Large space, quality coffee, and not too loud our busy like the 24 hr. Starbucks which is over saturated.    The only negative thing I have to say about the place is the limited menu.

4.5 so I rounded up.  The baristas were nice, and its generally a good crowd. Very chill, there's work space and hang out space.  Including a Nintendo Entertainment System.  The ambience is unique and gives you plenty to look at.  The -.5 point was for no reason except for the wow factor, but overall it just feels good, so I would recommend it any day.

Regrettably walked past this place many times without realizing it was a coffee shop. Total recommend to grab something for the task of browsing through Myopic close by.  I went with the safe choice of a vanilla latte, the syrup wasn't overwhelming, but the espresso seemed a bit weak.

I confess, I love this gimmick.  Who wouldn't be excited about a giant delorean, an actual nintendo with the original mario brothers and duck hunt to play, and an entire place stocked full of walks down memory lane?  I can never get any work done when I come here, but that's probably not the point.
Great Staff. Comfy Sofa. Very low key... yet busy. I Likes.

Ample seating and a working Delorean time machine equals one kick butt summer.  Tetris practice session and professional instruction every Tuesday from dr. M. Ullmer.  Also try the coffee and vegan donuts.

I stopped in at The WormHole Cafe and had The Invisible Touch ( Cucumber lemon soda with rosewater foam) it was pretty delicious and refreshing. The service wasn't that great, the people at the counter weren't too friendly and I waited for a couple of minutes before they seemed to notice me. They weren't rude exactly, just not attentive.

Anyplace that has the Delorean from Back To The Future has got to be cool as hell! The Wormhole definitely does not disappoint . It serves great coffee and tea and they're chocolate chip pretzel cookies are the bomb. There is some great 80's memorabilia on the walls that makes me want to cheer for Ducky all over again (Sorry for the Pretty in Pink reference). Free wi-fi and cool baristas, Wormhole is one of my favorite Wicker Park hangouts.

I love this place! Their coffee is to die for, everything I've every tried has been outstanding. Although, I usually just go for the drip coffee and I swear it's the best in the city. Makes my day every time. Also, the decor in the place is awesome!

One word: Delorean.

We walked by when they were still getting ready, and knew we would be back when WH actually opened. They are fantastic, and they just delight me. The seats are comfy, the coffee is amazing (I recommend the orange chocolate mocha concoction whole-heartedly), the iced teas on selection are generally fantastic.

While I'm aware we already have one eighties themed cafe in the area, I've gotta say, WH is greater than New Wave by quite a bit.
Single origin coffees (including some wet process), slow dripped.  They even know how the beans are processed, and they have line of their own roasts.

Fell in love with this place at first sight. The coffee is great, some of the best I've had in the city, especially the vanilla bean latté. There's almost always somewhere comfy to sit, and often the chairs or something near them will be *awesome*--the 80's/sci-fi decor is like a crazy flashback to my 80's/sci-fi childhood. (The DeLorean is great, but I have a soft spot for all the plush Ninja Turtles scattered around the room.) The Wi-Fi is free, but they change the password regularly so it's not being mooched by half the neighborhood and so is usually pretty fast and reliable, and there are a ridiculous number of open power outlets for your laptop.

May not be the best coffee place in Chicago, but it's my favorite. The food selection isn't the best (though it's similar to Intelligentsia; both have packaged sandwiches from Southport Grocery, plus pastries) but if you need lunch you can go to Filter down the block, or any of the other fine Wicker Park dining establishments. This place is about fine coffee and nerdy comfort, and friends, it delivers.

Everyone kept talking about this coffeeshop with a Dalorean in Wicker Park, but I never made it here until a few weeks ago.

Everything about this coffeeshop is great. Good yet unobtrusive tunes, hip yet friendly baristas, campy retro posters on the wall, and deliciously well-prepared beverages. Both the mocha and chai latte are A+ and I am going to try the peanut butter latte next... (doesn't that sound awesome?) And though I'm not one for video games, you can totally play the original Nintendo here if you want.

It's great for both surfing the internet, and meeting friends for a coffee. Sometimes it's a little hard to find seating because it's pretty popular... but I'm definitely going to be a regular here.

PS I'm in Wormhole right now.

This is definitely my new go to coffee place. I just moved to wicker park, so I was looking for a new coffee haunt, preferably to a chain. And this one fits the bill. Cool atmosphere, nice staff, and GREAT drinks. So far I've had the iced coffee, iced chai, red iced tea and the KoopaTroopa Mocha, all of which were fantastic. I was definitely a little worried that the KoopaTroopa would be overly sweet and syrupy, but was pleasantly surprised when I found out it was subtle and delicious. It might be my favorite thing on the menu (so far). The only knock I have on the place is that the take their time making the drinks, which stressed me out a bit when I was trying to catch a bus. But, the drinks are well worth the slight wait, and very reasonably priced.

if wormhole and filter had a baby, that coffee shop would be the best coffee shop in the entire world.  even as is, the wormhole is pretty darn awesome and difficult to beat.

1.  they sell cereal.  at 8:30 PM, i was hungry and got myself a bowl of half reeses pb cups, half cinnamon toast crunch + soy milk.  YUMMO.  they're also currently doing a deal where if you buy something before 9 AM, you get a FREE bowl of cereal.  

2.  beautiful lattes.  always perfect with flawless designs.  my only complaint is that sometimes the milk is lukewarm.  heat the milk to almost a boil, please?

3.  the service is professional, friendly, and super duper helpful.  to the contrary, the guy behind the counter at filter lives with a scowl on his face and sometimes deigns to snarl a reply to my obviously inane question.

4.  the music doesn't suck.  sometimes it's weird, e.g. they played destiny's girl for waaaay too long one afternoon, but at least it's not too loud or repetitive.  at filter, you can't block out the music with your headphones and it puts you at risk for falling into a trance.

5.  open late.  an hour later than filter!

however...areas where they could improve:

1.  sell more food!  sell sandwiches and soup and salads so i can camp out here for as long as i like.  sometimes i go to filter because i'm hungry and need fuel to start working.

2.   be bigger!  okay, so this is unreasonable -- but consider yourself lucky if you find a table seat at the wormhole and actually have a spot where you can feasibly camp out and still get work done.  TODAY IS MY LUCKY DAY!!!!!!

3.  offer different choices for drip coffee!! the one they usually serve is not my preferred flavor, and sometimes i need more than one option.

that's about it  in my mind, wormhole beats filter as the better wicker park coffee shop -- but the plentiful seating and food options at filter often woo me over.

Ok, so I finally had a chance to check out Wormhole last night, and I have to say, I am really impressed.

First, let me say, I compare coffee shops on three criteria:

1. Quality of coffee
2. Decor
3. Location

Having said that, Wicker Park (and Bucktown, too) has always needed better coffee shop options. When I lived over in Lakeview, it always seemed like no matter what part of that area you found yourself at any given time, there was a good coffee shop just around the corner...whether it was Intelligensia, Argo Tea, Julius Meinl or Uncommon Ground, you didn't have to go far.

However, over here in our awesome WP neighborhood, it seemed like the only good option, after the original Filter had closed a few years back, was Alliance, which is all the way down on Division; simply too far of a walk for me considering I was living way up past North Avenue.

But now that Filter has thankfully returned, we all of a sudden have the Wormhole (whose surprising arrival has resulted in a sort of cornucopia of coffee shops for our neighborhood), and I must say, it is more than welcome. Filter is great, but I was underwhelmed by the space itself. Wormhole seems to have all three criteria lined up: Great coffee, great space, and great location.

About the space itself, as others have mentioned, it is based on an 80's movie/toy/stainless-steel Delorian theme. I particularly liked the dark blue color, which, combined with the awesome artwork on display, created an eclectic and mysterious vibe.

The coffee was damn good too, and I can tell you right now, that this will become my new default coffee shop tout de suite.

Well my memory of the 80's pretty much begins and ends with Back to the Future, the smurfs, and embarrassing my father attempting to play little league, but this place is just awesome.  My normal order anywhere is a large iced coffee with sugar free something or other.  I was initially dismayed to hear they didn't have sugar free syrup, but relaxed a bit when I found it it was all made from scratch organic.    Ended up being a non-issue the coffee didn't require a bunch of extras to make it taste great.  Not usually one to order iced tea but did so on recommendation, it was also fantastic.  Too coffee ignorant to know about the fancier drinks but my friends that were with me were raving about them.  

The other thing that jumped out was how well staffed the place was.  A lot of places have a great product but staff one or at most two people behind the counter, these guys always seem to be well staffed and more importantly the staff seems to work in sync with each other.  No matter how busy the place is I don't have to wait more than a minute or so to get served - if there's a wait at all.

Stopped by on the saturday they opened to grab an iced latte.  They seemed to still be setting up shop, so didn't have much food, but the coffee was great.  Much better coffee than my other option down the street (filter) where the coffee tastes a bit over-roasted.  The ambiance is not quite as nice as filter, but it was a lot less crowded, (as of yet anyways).  I also enjoyed that I didn't smell like fried food as I do coming out of filter.  And the girls working were super nice and friendly!  I will definitely be back the next time I need a place to chill with a tasty cuppa.

Ok, so this review turned into a "let's compare filter and wormhole"  but there you go!

There is a Delorean in the window! This is what initially made me walk in and try some coffee. This is one of my favorite places to camp out in the city. It's pretty cozy in the fall/winter months. Personally, my favorite seat in the house is the fuzzy mushroom stool, which is comfy to study on or play NES....yes they have a NES.
   The drinks are yummy. The vanilla latte is delightful and they also have a matcha spicy some kind of tea that taste uber good, but is for dine in only.  They also sell a variety of macaroons that pair well with their latte options.
  My favorite part about this place is thinking about it in the context of Back to the Future 2. (This is going to sound nuts but hear me out)
In Back to the Future 2, Marty McFly goes to 2015 and ends up in an 80's themed cafe and his mind is blown. That is this coffee shop. If Marty McFly were to set the time machine just a few years early to lets say Nov 25th 2011 and leave Hill Valley for Chicago. He would end up at the wormhole, no question.

Our weekly comics creator group was looking for a new place to meet after Atlas Cafe closed. The group moderator suggested this place. Awesome choice. Some coffee shops don't do tea well. It's like you're a third class citizen if you're not having coffee. Not here. They have a nice selection of loose teas and they are served in bodum cups. There's a nice selection of treats as well. I had a couple macarons that were quite tasty. The staff is friendly and helpful unlike Filter where at around 7 pm everyone is in full get the fuck outa here mode. My Server looked kinda like Bettie Page and was very nice. She suggested a list of teas for me and was very helpful. It gets a little crowded late so keep that in mind. They have a working nintendo and 80's nostalgia abounds.Oh, and don't forget the free WiFi!

Cool decor, lots of space to sit. but more importantly, AMAZING soy lattes. It's really hard to make good soy foam. I had a cappuccino that blew me away --- paired with a vegan donut or muffin from fritz pastry (the best in the world)! Even the iced lattes are made with serious talent.

This place was soooo awesome. I was meeting up with a couple of people last night who suggested Wormhole as our spot. I LOVED the 80s decor. There were Rainbow Brites, Gremlins, Atari, an actual DeLorean, Star Wars posters, and more scattered all around the bar. I decided to try the Honey Bear Blossom Latte in the small 8oz size. You can tell that everything there is made with care and quality. The milk is steamed as each customer orders so it's fresh and delicious. The baristas also make latte art in every drink which adds to the experience. The honey/espresso combination was DELICIOUS. I thought it would be a bit strange but the flavors complemented each other really nicely! And it was just enough drink to give me an evening zing and satisfy me. None of these 20oz monstrosities to contend with. The clientele fit right into the hipster neighborhood stereotype but it seems that people go there to meet in groups, get some work done, surf the net, maybe write some code, and it was just an overall happy place! The bathrooms were clean and there was an extensive pastry selection. I would love to go back and I would highly recommend warming up in this spot if you're ever in the area!
Great coffee shop to relax and unwind.  I tried their chai, it was delicious.

Let me be frank. I love the wormhole. I live and breathe the wormhole. I am at times even one with the wormhole. It gives me life. It gives me caffeine. It even giveth me free-wifi, no limits. The baristas are always awesome, the drinks spectacularly made.

However, it saddens me greatly and to no avail that one of my favorite baristas, nay, people, has been fired from this coffee house, someone who literally was the reason why I even gave this place a chance in the first place, someone who I had great meaningful conversations about nothing with. She is a true joy and I'm sad that now that being that she has been let go, and I am not familiar with the particulars, current and future patrons will not have the opportunity to say they were served by the D. It was because of her that I fell in love with this place and now something is truly missing here. This is why wormhole doth not get 5 stars, though it certainly would have gotten 5 stars a few weeks ago. However, avid yelpers, don't let this deter you from this great establishment. This post is primarily a catharsis for me. D you are missed!

J

Ok let me just say when I originally visited this joint the first time I was sprung. It took me back to my roots and I was digging the cafe, funky decor, free wifi, and coziness. However, on my next visit I drove out about 20 minutes so I could settle in with some yummy coffee and hook up to the wifi to get some work done. I ordered my gigs and went to settle in but to my surprise I had forgotten my power cord and my battery on my laptop was dead. I packed my things back up and when  I went back up front for my coffee I advised the woman at the counter that I now needed my coffee to go. I got the stank eye and a lecture stating that the next time I wanted it to go that I should let them know ahead if time and that normally they don't just pour the coffee in a to go cup but that they make it over again and would charge me for it! I advised her that it was not my intention to leave but things happen. No love from the wormhole gang! Guess I'll be going back to my first love... Ipsento where at least the people are friendly!!!
The vanilla bean late was delicious, love the vibe in here, staff is great! will definitely be back!

It's a cool spot and they play good music. But the coffee is terrible!! People have made comments that they're flavored espresso drinks are good - probably because the flavor covers up the bitterness of the espresso. Anyhow I'm not impressed.

Great Ambience, great coffee from Metropolis, great service.  Beautiful shop, beautiful people everywhere. I'd go there every day if I could.

But there's this one guy, I think his name's Seth?  You know, the really hairy gay guy.  I mean super hairy.  That guy has hair like you wouldn't believe.  But I asked him for some water this week and he filled it with piss!  He whipped it right out and just filled the glass up.  I was so grossed out.  And then he slammed it down on the table and said "have a great day, a**hole."  I'm glad that guy's leaving this week.  I hope Milwaukee enjoys him, but I, for one, am glad he's leaving.  

So definitely go to Wormhole, but watch out for Seth.  That guy is like the barista devil incarnate.

Once there was a girl named Juliet who moved from the suburbs to Wicker Park. She did this so she would no longer need to drive everywhere and spend her hard earned cash at chain stores. (And because the suburbs are where dreams go to die. It's true. Wikipedia it.)

On her first day in the new neighborhood, she journeyed out on foot rather than in her Chrysler, in search of what she needed most to stay alive: coffee. She heard stories from new neighbors and a real estate agent of this mythical coffee procurement site where the iced coffee was as strong as He-Man and as refreshing as a first kiss. Of a place where the vanilla in the vanilla lattes was handmade with love, rather than poured from a vat of high-fructose corn syrup. A place that had neither "star" nor "bucks" in its name, but it did have a DeLorean. Could this place be real? Or is it like a story we tell our children at night to help their dreams be filled with peace and calm?

Oh, it's real, Juliet learned. It is so damn real... Wormhole Coffee is everything a mythical coffeehouse should be. Aside from astonishingly perfect coffee, the people who run the joint are kind and fun and clearly take enormous pride in their establishment. It's a place where Darth Vader sits at the front counter and Ronald Reagan wears a dunce hat. People - employees and customers -  smile at each other at Wormhole. Genuine lips-parted-teeth-showing smiles. There is no other place like that in Wicker Park.

Go here! Drink! Eat! Smile! REPEAT!!

Coffee is really great and the Vanilla Bean Latte is to die for!! I LOVE the 80's 90's decor...it made me feel like a kid again! I'm also really interested in trying their cereal drinks. I have yet to sample the food but according to other reviews I may wanna wait until they get the kinks worked out.

The only reason why it's 4 not 5 stars is because the service wasn't very nice and I had to wait quite awhile for my latte and there was NO line in front of me. Off day maybe?? We'll see how it goes next time...

The first time i went to wormhole, I walked in and thought - "Oh my god. This is AWESOME." I ordered the Kupa Trupa - which is my favorite coffee drink ever. The baristas make the coffee with such artistry that it's hard not to absolutely love everything about this place.

Between the collection of classic lunchables and the 1980's memorabilia, this place is a WIN.

One time, I saw it on groupon, and it was wonderful. I brought a few friends and introduced them to the goodness of Wormhole.

Love this place!! Bring my friends from out of town here bc they're home-made vanilla bean lattes are delicious and how can you say no to a cozy couch with the old school box nintendo and games like super mario!! They also have the back to the future car inside and random lunch boxes lining the wall. Very unique vintage-feel coffee shop

Vegan pastries are foul.

No, no... just stop right there. Shut your ass and stop arguing. There's nothing pleasant about gnawing on something that has the consistency of sweetened, wet sand.

When you say to yourself,

"WOW! I AM REALLY ENJOYING THIS VEGAN PASTRY!"

this is what you're actually thinking... in that quiet, secret part of your mind that also doesn't want to admit that Jerseylicious is a very enjoyable show and Geoffrey Rush is kinda hot in a grody old-man kinda way...

"Yeah, here I am... tolerating this passable vegan pastry."

I'm including this diatribe because I've yet to figure out if wormhole has real pastries (like the ones that have animal fat and deliciousness in them) or just ethical ones.

Woof. Enough of that. The coffee is quite nice here but I don't recommend being in any sort of a hurry for it. It's not only a process at the Wormhole, it's a fucking ordeal.

When you've stood there for a good 5-10 minutes watching 4 trendy sorts in a complete flap behind the counter, your drink will eventually arrive. Now it won't be terribly hot but it will have a pretty little design on the top and I'm always one of craftsmanshit (totally intentional misspelling) and all that. Fuck dude, while you're at it could you please make a Mandala out of cinnamon, cocoa and nutmeg? Not only do I have absolutely nowhere to be but I just want to destroy something beautiful.

Four stars for proximity, The Walter Peck and the fact that this place is so deliciously easy to make fun of. OK, I'm going to go eat some Ben & Jerry's and put a few more dents in my ass.

This place is 80s nostalgia to the extreme. A nice big late 70s floor model TV has old school Atari video games customers can play. Not to mention the full scale Delorean vehicle all tricked out in Back to The Future II style. Aside from the great ambiance, the staff is always super friendly and very down to earth. The staff also seems very educated on different types of coffee beans which I really appreciate as a long time coffee fan. It's also a great place to grab your laptop, buy some coffee and sit down for hours working or just hanging out.

The Cosby - the special right now - is quite delightful! It tastes like bananas, they stick a vanilla wafer on top and they don't skimp on the whipped cream. Yum! The only thing I can say is it's a bit pricey. Spending $4-5 on a 12 ounce cup of coffee seems like a lot (when I'm used to my ginormous cups of coffee from Starbucks for under $3), but the creativeness of the options, the friendliness of the staff and the overall atmosphere make it worth it again. Speaking of the atmosphere, it's very conducive to making friends. There are lots of shared spaces, i.e., long tables with lots of spots for hipstery, young folks with Apple products to work and/or study, cozy little couches and chairs with tables strategically placed so you kind of can't ignore your neighbors. Someone saw what I was reading and it sparked a pleasant conversation. I love these types of coffee shops! Highly recommended if you like interesting coffee choices (they have a peanut butter one I'm going to have to try next time) and are a friendly person :)

Currently my new favorite coffee shop in Chicago!  Spacious, lots of 80's memorabilia, clean bathrooms, interesting and creative drinks, vegan (and also non-vegan) treats, and free wifi!  Great for hipsters and nerds, or for people-watching the hipsters and nerds.  I had the "Tim Curry" drink but it seems like they change the menu quite often. Also had the "Rocket Sauce."

sexy looking coffee that discourages you from wanting to add sugar or drink from the glass.

once you get over the artwork and mix it up; you can taste the milk at a lovely temperature and deliciously pressurized coffee.

place is packed though with people who buy one thing and sit all day : (

oh.. and the macaroons are whatever..

nice staff. nice brew.... love it.
Had some best time there. Definitely try their homemade vanilla beans latte.

I don't usually complain.... but.  I used to go to Wormhole pretty regularly and still do enjoy the ambiance of the pace.  After not coming here for a while, these last two times I've been there I have been less than impressed with the staff.  They act immature and quite unprofessional, flirting with each other and having conversations about mutual friends and sex as if the customers can't hear.  Well, we can.  Also, for a coffee shop that is supposed to close at 11pm, it's not the most welcoming feeling to hear a vacuum running at 10:30- when there's still a good amount of people still there.  At this point, the main reason I'll be going there is because they're open later than other coffee shops.  And that's about it.

Great space, great decor, music is good and isn't crazy-loud, coffee was fantastic and so was the latte art. The space is well laid out with lots of seating and no cramped areas. There's a working Nintendo and a full-sized model of the Back to the Future Delorean! The music was a point of discussion with the staff trying to guess whose song as whose. Apparently they all have good taste, because I didn't hear a bad choice the whole time. I had a vanilla bean latte, which tasted like vanilla bean, not extract. Delicious. I also took a drip coffee to go, and while the variety wasn't my favorite, I can't fault the roast or brewing for that. My friend who's a coffee worker in Boston commented on their great latte art, and I agreed.

As a new resident in the Wicker Park neighborhood, my girlfriend and I were in search of an interesting coffee place to spend some time on a Tuesday afternoon. I'm glad we found The Wormhole!

The Chai Latte and Metropolitan Espresso we ordered were artistically done and absolutely delicious. Our visit was further improved by the free WiFi connection (note: login info is available on the little cards in the seating areas), nerdy, nostalgia-inducing decor, and the humorous Yelp-review and response between the owner and 'Matt L.' which took place on June 3.

We'll be back!
The drinks are very good but it is way too crowded and dark for me.

bottomless coffee!
Free & Efficient Wi-Fi!
Late hours!
Win!

Not only was I flashed back to the 80's as I left the wormhole I was also flashed back to the mid 90's as I rode my bike home thinking about Ice cubes song "Today was a good day".  However in my version it went like "Today was a good day as I got an Ice coffee for free" .  yes they offer a free cup of coffee to anyone that rides a bike before 9:00 am.  This is crazy I must admit I almost felt guilty taking it.  Not only was it free but oustanding, by far the best coffee in the neighborhood I do not know why anyone goes to starbucks.  Also the people that work their are awesome and are great for early morning conversations.  Last sunday I went and had a 20 minute conversation with the employees about Mike Tyson Punch out for Nintendo.  Yes they have it in the shop and you can play it.  They have over 25 nintendo games to play.     Also they have a real delorian car in the shop.  This place is like a museaum.  I would love to see the guys from American Pickers try to go to this place.  Ok before I digress let me bullet point benefits.

1. great coffee
2. great price
3. the place is a museum
4. unlimited nintendo
5. free coffee before 9 am if you ride a bike(no catch)

bottom line get involved

I love the Honey Bear Latte here!  So good. I am also very impressed that even when I order a latte iced, they still steam the milk, so you can enjoy the delicious frothiness expected of a hot latte.  They have another drink that I was recently introduced to called the tomahawk, which has steamed milk, matcha and a hint of cayenne. Wormhole has a cool 80's themed decor, complete with a functioning Super nintendo with 2 dozen games, bar seats as well as multiple couches, long tables and a Delorean.  It feels like I'm hanging out at a friend's Mom's basement, if the said Mom also baked macarons and was an amazing barista.

I LOVE this cafe. I'm in love with its atmosphere, and it's peanut butter koopa troopa. The lines can be long, but that's no more than an indication of how great their coffee is. They also have a solid selection of pastries and snacks (and macaroons!). This place is perfect for a before-work coffee, or any time, for that matter.
Not that this place needs another good review, but the espresso is amazing, the staff is helpful and awesome, and the atmosphere is amusing and clean. Love this place for work or play.
Great coffee, great atmosphere, great location, great music. Love coming here to do work then shop around Wicker Park afterwards.

I know its in your typical "hipster" neighborhood of Wicker Park but there's something about this area that is allowed the hipster status without rolling my eyes. It reminds me of gotham city meets greenwich village. Then you have Wormhole Coffee, it has got to be the coolest place to sit it with the most amazing taste in coffee by far and the most creative baristas as they swirl your cup with some leafy design. Yeah, I'll say it, I'll admit to it, I'm sold on this whole hipster idea - as long as were in Wicker Park sipping a cup of peanut butter mocha latte at wormhole.

I liked the Wormhole, but I didn't love it. Granted, the DeLorean was pretty cool. And, I enjoyed seeing the other kitschy throwbacks in the place--they had Gremlins! But, the place was dang crowded, which I guess isn't a bad thing. Goes to show they make very good coffee! But, as it always is with me, I rate on the prices. I thought it was too expensive for what I got (iced coffee). I would like to go again and try some food or other beverages, but for now, they are a solid B in my book...

I didn't get coffee, so I feel like I'm unable to rate this place higher.  I had a chai which wasn't the best I've had but wasn't terrible.  However, I did have a wonderful pistachio currant scone!  My friend from Minneapolis was in town and wanted to try the coffee on the basis of a recommendation from a friend.  He said it was really excellent.  Fun decor.  Kids in the back were playing old school Nintendo which made me jealous!

man if i was still in Chicago i think i would come to this cafe so often i'd be considered a regular.

so very hip, relaxed, unique. loved it! books along the couches, tabled areas to study. it's just perfect. and even more perfect for college students.

their coffee was unique too!!

i had the DRUNKEN CITRUS MOCHA. i usually stick with regular black coffee but the name of this drink caught my attention i had to try it. and im sure glad i did! it didn't have an overpowering mocha taste like Starbucks iced mocha does. and their hint of citrusy sweetness made it honestly--- delightful!

my friend ordered the HONEY BEAN LATTE. which was also pretty good!

man.. i really wish i could go back here as often as i please. sad!!
can they please move to nyc? pretty please?

simply amazing.
this is exactly how i wish my whole life was designed.
lots of 80's movie/music/pop culture memorabilia lining the walls, cool variety of furniture, great drinks, old famicon consoles on a wood tv cabinet.
i feel like i'm in the 80's again.

oh. and.
A FUCKING TIME MACHINE.

seriously, just great.
great atmosphere, free internets, and a classy nerdy design motif.
hell, even their wireless passwords are amusing.

would be great if they had more snacks, but very content with everything this place is about.

also, would be cool if you could sit in the delorean, you can't, i asked.

between all the vinyl shopping, trendy boutiques and local artisy flavor along the milwaukee strip, you'll probably hit up this place for a coffee break. beware: wormhole packs a serious dose of 80s nostalgia, deloreans and nintendo paraphernalia galore. plus, the coffee is not over roasted and the donuts taste like grandma made them just for you. is this heaven?

p.s. to all you cusack fans, walk down milwaukee towards honore street and you'll stand before the backdrop from "high fidelity". holla!

i really wish the Worm would be sensitive to having a suuuper large mug for their large drink sizes. I hate landfills. I wish all the folks behind counters were nice behind counter people... Sometimes they are friendly and effervescent, other times gloomster, and or perfunctory. Otherwise coffee and pulls are top notch. And be prepared to wait for the coffee decant of the week, the "pour over".

At first glance, the shop of 1462 Milwaukee doesn't scream at passerby's. What the black, unnamed front hides within does quite the opposite. Perhaps the chalk sign resting ostentatiously outside the door, holding words such as "gaiz" or "nom-able", attempts to entice walkers to challenge "Le Bestest Jave In The Country".

By now, most folks of the Wicker Park homeland have all heard the almost overstated phrase  "the coffee shop with the DeLorean". Once this initial nostalgia has been passed, guests are thrown into an ambiance embracing the childhood essence of owner Travis Schaffner. "I just wanted to be unique and wanted to be fun and make it memorable", Travis told a Columbia Chronicle writer. Collectible lunch boxes, the recently updated 80's film posters and cozy couch settings make Wormhole a tough scene to not instantly be captivated by; countless guests are caught daily gazing almost aimlessly throughout the shop, being able to find something new with every visit.

While I have heard countless remarks of "no seats available", I seem to have always been uncannily blessed with being able to find seating when so desired; moons cannot count how many occasions and different times of day my being has frequented this shop. I have heard rumors of an up and coming new floor plan for seating that is sure to please even more. While I've seen it quite busy, it has always seemed calm and organized through the madness. When the craving seems right, classic video games seem to satisfy. I can honestly say I am most proud of them for acquiring the game 'Clash at Demonhead' just recently. I highly recommend letting your thumbs experience this awesomeness. Having been a regular since opening month, it has been exciting to watch the growth in the last six months of not only the bariste, but the shop as a whole. Renegade Art Fair swarms to "have more candy next year" Halloween notes, this fresh, new cafe has been challenged to the core to learn and adapt extremely fast to the wants and desires of its crowds. Their first year will be a journey not to be taken for granted.

Most importantly, the coffee. This is the real reason they have become unforgettable. Implementing the sale and brew of impeccable single-origin beans of local roasters, such as Star Lounge and Metropolis, to Seattle's Victrola or San Francisco's Ritual, Wormhole goes through a delicate and extensive process of cuppings to select the beans reflecting the beauty of not only the Arabica itself, but the skill and craftsmanship of its roaster. Experimentation and creativity boom through the hands of its baristas. From this past summers 'Sexican', with agave nectar and cayenne pepper, to this months 'Winter Formal', sweet basil latte with cardamom and almond, taste buds are left with always wanting more. Fritz Pastry delights offer guests some of the tastiest 11pm snacks an overworked person could ever want; if ever-want beith the case, 'Mocha Puffs' and 'Chai-ros' will come to the rescue.

Constant friendly service of its outstanding staff and its exceptionally fast free wifi, which has a bi-weekly changing password that keeps that status forever true, Wormhole has taken their passion of coffee and people to the next level. Realizing of course that they are all still human, perhaps it is unfair to demand perfection every second. They carry with them a sense of humor and love of life that is so often forgotten. You're not a stranger here; you're family in a beautiful way and I look forward to 2011 with great anticipation. The Force is strong with this one.

I have been coming to Wormhole since it has opened up. Their barista's are perfectionist and Metropolis is such a first rate brew. The decor has a swanky blend of modern and 80/90s kid elements which couldnt be more relevant or location appropriate.

But I didnt specifically make this Yelp account to talk about how cool Wormhole is, I signed up to vent about how one of their barista's singled me out and blatantly disrespected me.

I arrived at Wormhole around 8:30pm to meet up with a friend. I was early so I helped myself to some drink. Didnt feel like coffee so I settled on a Chai Latte. After telling the sterile faced barista what I was in the mood for, she promptly gave me my total, $3.02...being short on change I asked her if she had 2 cents but I knew the answer to that question...the patron before me paid for their tea in dimes, nickels, and pennies that she had not placed in the register yet. Anyway I asked her for 2 cents and she immediately said no. Not a big deal. So I took another dollar from my wallet and gave her the grand total of $4. She gave me my change back and I put it all in the tip jar. I then saw her place the fourth dollar I gave her in the tip jar as well. She didnt ask for my name like she was suppose to, so my Chai Latte took about 7 minutes to make....

So yeah, this may just be a fluke experience but I have some time to kill and decided on bitching about that bitch of a barista. Aside from her, Wormhole aint bad at all.

Really like this coffee shop.  The coffee was good, service was friendly. Would like more pastry choices . . . relaxing atmosphere, I think that the car needs to somehow be positioned upside down on the ceiling.  So we can look at it but it doesn't take up seating space. whatevs . . .

Solid 4.5 stars for the awesome nostalgic decoration of the place and making you feel right at home. The drinks are great and come can with art if yours comes with foam. They know what they are doing and service comes with a smile and sometimes a joke. So why the 1/2 star taken off? For lack of seating in the place. Its not that big of a place and seeing how there's a Delorean and its a trendy place I would think there would be more seating options / better layout? =/ I love the place, can highly recommend it for any occasion, and oh - free Wifi!
Great vibe, good coffee, free wifi, fabulous decor. I love love love the 80s =)

What's there not to love? I love trying local coffee shops when I visit new cities, and actually decided to give Wormhole a shot based on all the good Yelp reviews. It did not disappoint. Typical hipster style coffee house and baristas. You have to love the retro video game theme throughout. There's even a Super Nintendo with a whole myriad of games to choose to play on a really old school TV. Also, they make all their flavor syrups in house! It's not your typical, boring Monin brand bland garbage that you find at most coffee shops. My only complaint is that they did not have a true "large" size available. The largest size they had was available for espresso drinks was 12 oz., which is most coffeehouses' small size. Based on the prices ($4.50 for 12 oz. latte), you would think you were getting a 20 oz. or more drink. Larger 16 oz. cups were available for drip coffee only. Not really sure why. Other than that, I can't complain! I would definitely go again!
The place looks nice, good for big or small group hang out. Good coffee too!
cool place....unique atmosphere....awesome coffee. where else can you play mario on nintendo for free?
What a great place for Coffee and people watching!  They know what they are doing in the coffee department - go enjoy.  and check out the Delorean in the front window.

delicious coffee (plenty of options, but just a regular old iced coffee was absolutely divine - which is not something you can say about every place that serves it) and a unique atmosphere. i would definitely go here to read, study, hang out, etc.

I love the retro look and feel of this place! It's a great place to get some work done and then crash on the couch for a video game break. Gotta love the old school nintendo! Guests are really cool here too...I've met some pretty friendly people studying here.

Ahh to feel home again. Yes, I am a child of the 80s and yes, like another reviewer said, this place feels like everyone's bedroom from their childhood--right down to the lunchboxes lining the walls.

I've always had a great cup of coffee here. I guarantee that after trying their drinks, you will find it hard to back to the "hard stuff" served by the green giant.

The Wormhole is my favorite coffee shop in Chicago. You can sit there and relax with a Chai Tea or Vanilla Latte, sitting on a couch playing Super Mario 3 or Duck Hunt on SNES, or take out your laptop and work there for hours on those long tables. There's Ghostbusters/Princess Bride movie posters, a replica Back to the Future DeLorean, an ET stuffed animal, and a bunch of other 80s-90s paraphernalia.

Awesome coffee shop.  Great coffee, cool baristas.  I am kinda shy and I always feel like I can just walk up to the counter and chat with people.  They are friendly, and smart, and damn, they make good coffee.

This place is awesome! The 80's theme is a great throwback for this 80's kid. I was ecstatic to see all the little Gremlin dolls by the coffee maker and the rest of the decor is 80's kitschy! Oh, did I mention the DeLorean in the window? You can't miss it--so cool!

Now the coffee. They have an awesome coffee/espresso selection and you aren't limited to just one roaster or the generic assortment of caffeinated drinks. They have a creative menu that takes coffee to the next level which any coffee drinker can appreciate.

The day I went I tried the Tiger's Blood Ice Coffee which is a rather small serving and they don't serve it "to go." But I could seriously drink about 5 of these bad boys. It's a coconut, blood orange espresso drink and it's crazy delicious; mad, crazy good. I watched the barrista create my concoction and let me tell you, it looked really complicated, so I'm not even going to try this at home. They one me over!

My boyfriend tried their Peanut Butter Koopa something or other and that was really good as well. It was a little rich for me but the cute little flower made it look extra appealing. This is like breakfast in a cup.

I would recommend definitely drinking your goods there as opposed to being all "starbucks" about it and dashing out the door with your sleeved-paper cup. They have cool little bumper stickers for gratis that have pretty cool messages that are rather comical. That makes this place even cooler. Some people may think this place is a little pricey but for the quality your getting it's well worth your hard-earned dollar(s).

Great Scott! The kitschy vintage decor and video game/fantasy/film memorabilia make this place impossible to walk by. I mean, how many DeLoreans do you see in the average coffee shop? Or a working top loader NES console with a bazillion games? All that aside, the coffee is super solid. The espresso drinks and seasonals (my favorite was Rocket Sauce: an iced yerba mate drink with ginger syrup) are terrific, and pour over coffee is also available if you're not into burnt, yucky urn coffee. Unfortunately, the totally unsurprising popularity of this place has made it almost impossible to find a seat between the hours of 9 AM - Close. And it's not like there aren't plenty of tables either. But despite the non-stop MacBook convention, Wormhole is a blast every time.

Tea and French macarons - sign me up!!  Great atmosphere, though it's a little crowded to find a spot to sit and sip.  Super friendly staff - I love to watch how they create each drink with such care.

Great tasting coffee with nostalgic decor. I love the fact that they have a nintendo game system hooked up to a tv so you can sip your java while sitting on a comfy couch saving the princess. Pretty slow service but I think it is meant to be. Staff could also be a little friendlier.
