The DeLorean in the front window gave me a little chuckle, but other than that this place blows.  I usually don't get annoyed very easily, but even the wifi password was very cutesy dutesy and it was something like "thebarristawhopicksherteethandbiteshernailswantsa­ttentionbutdontgiveittoherbecausethenshewillgetall­imthebestandstuff"  I'm not kidding.  Come on that's just dumb.  I was hungry and my choices were pbj and I think some natural wheat grass!  I'm not kidding.  In the 80s it was pepsi, madmax, the dominos pizza devil, and all back to the future 2 and what not.  Not wheat grass!

I had an issue with the conduct of one of the baristas, but after voicing this here on yelp, the owner of The Wormhole granted a genuine apology with a promise that such conduct is not tolerated and is not a reflection of his M.O.  My disrespect for the employee there has been neutralized by the newfound respect I have for the owner, who I can honestly say practices business with integrity, and by the consideration of the positive attributes of the coffee house: Tasty drinks; interesting and nostalgic atmosphere.
Wormhole is my favorite cafe in Chicago. It's a must see if you're a Sci-Fi fan.
I've been coming here since I moved to the area a couple of years ago and it's only gotten better with time. Great coffee, great food, and great people.

My girlfriend loves her coffee. She's been drinking coffee since she was four.

We walk in, the coffee shop is packed. A bunch of professional work-at-home types as well as students and the like have this place filled up. We get there, and my girlfriend decides she wants to find us a seat while I order our drinks. I chose to pick a Babocino as it was on the menu. She asks me to order something called a "café con leche"... And so before I could ask her any questions about the drink, I'm assuming at this point, that's it's on the menu and she kind of just darts away from me looking for seats.... well, I'm looking at the menu, and I don't see it anywhere. She's way over there looking for our seats. I'm standing at the counter getting nervous over what the heck a "café con leche" is. Anyways, my turn comes up in the line, and I order my Babocino (from the menu) and then I'm trying to remember the name of the drink she wanted... "uhhh, do you guys carry a drink called a Cafe Com Le Cina" ( I had no idea what the heck I just ordered ).... and neither did the counter lady. She goes, "a cafe what?!? Do you know what's in that?". I tell her "no", i just know what it's called...."

I look over, she's still over there finding us a seat, and the counter lady is losing her patience with me because she has no idea what I just ordered. I have no idea what I ordered either! Anyways, my girlfriend had ended up ordering her own drink and got a Cafe Au Lait.

Later that night, I'm telling her my story about this, and she told me she ordered a "cafe au lait". But wait, I thought she said something like a Cafe Com Lecheee or something like that. She say's they are the same drink. And tells me that it's just coffee with milk....

At this point, I'm silent for about a minute looking at her with a frown of disappointment on my face, "oh, so it was just coffee and milk?... coffee and milk?!? Why didn't you just say coffee with milk?!? I had no idea what a cafe-come-here or cafe ole is, and they were asking me a description of the drink. You know what my response was to them? "um, I dunno a coffee drink?", and they got mad at me!

Every coffee shop, carryies this drink.

Anyways, we laughed hysterically about this story. One for the scrap books ;)

So, I feel totally old when I am here because I was actually a tween when I saw "The Goonies" etc..., and the baristas can be *very* slow, but the coffee is great.  I also like the prices on the macarons.  The pecan-oatmeal-chocolate chip cooke I ate today was delicious!
Love the place, the people, the feel oh and their honey bear latte is amazing!
Whenever I start my day at Wormhole I know it's going to be a great day! Such fun atmosphere, sweetest employees, & some of the best coffee I've ever, ever had!

Come on, who doesn't love an 80s themed coffee shop in the hipster part of town!  I mean there's even a frickin Delorian inside the place.  As for the coffee, seems pretty good, I'm more intrigued by the nostalgia of my childhood.  FYI This place gets pretty packed and apparently there is free wifi, so if you find a seat grab it quickly.

This place SEEMS like it is going to be all about the decor rather than the drinks, but it's not. I had a good latte that was not too expensive, and the atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed. I personally have had good service here consistently. Plus, you can play Nintendo. Good stuff.

This independent coffee shop has great coffee and tea as well as extremely fresh macaroons. Excellent service and interesting decor including a DeLorean and retro chairs & wall hangings (also movie related. Star Wars & other sci-fi). There are plenty of wall outlets and free wi-fi. Best coffee shop I've been to in Wicker Park.

Pshhh, like this place needs another great review.

Well, it does!  I've read quite a few of the past reviews, and I can't say that I agree that this place is all about hipsters, or that the baristas have an attitude (in a negative sense)... I met here with an old friend of mine and was a little iffy about coming here because I didn't think I'd "fit in" but I have to say, I have no idea what people are talking about. I am far from being a hipster and I found a pretty good mix of people here. The service was efficient and very friendly and the place was clean. Tables are hard to come by since it was quite busy, but we found a table outside and enjoyed our drinks. She had the PB Koopa Troopa and I had an iced VB Latte.  I found the espresso to be smooth and not bitter and the drink to be delicious. On our way out, we got an oatmeal cookie and a raspberry corn muffin... also yummy.
My only regrets were that we didn't really get to experience the fun nostalgic things inside the actual shop, but I'm sure I will come again and check them out then.

DeLoreans, swanky 80s-retro vibe, free WiFi, comfortable seating, mood lighting, great coffee, and all-around awesomeness.  I am a fan!  I visited on a Friday morning when I had the day off work, and this place definitely has a cool mood to it.  Peanut butter lovers, try their peanut butter flavored coffee--VERY good.  I'll definitely have to fit these guys into my weekly evening routine.

I think the main draw for me is the lounge-like atmosphere.  There's room to move around, unlike a lot of nearby shops that are elbow-to-elbow tables.  Whereas some places have one couch shoved in a corner, Wormhole has an eclectic mix of tables, couches, and chairs, clustered together to create several cozy nooks where groups of friends can sit down and relax.
Love this place! Best soy vanilla latte in Chicago!

We wandered in even though I'm not super into the whole 80s throwback thing. They do it well, though, even including Atari games on old TV sets. The coffee is the most important thing, though, and they've never let me down.
Great coffee, cool/comfortable atmosphere, really friendly staff, very accessible by blue line.....what more could you ask for?  The Delorian is really just over the top awesome.
Where did the joy go?   This place used to be welcoming and VERY cool.  The remodel makes it a colder environment and not as comfy.  Miss the old way...it was much better.

ummmm

not sure if they give out free macaroons to everyone, but the guy behind the counter today was QUITE the gentleman and surprised me and my friend by not only bringing our drinks to us, but offering us 2 petite macaroons on a plate.

now before this guy gets in trouble... this totally made my day. i'm not even kidding, hours later we were still talking about the wormhole. acts of kindness, much appreciated!

love love love the decor. too much fun. so thanks wormhole, i shall be back ;)
80s childhood nostalgia coffee bar complete with super nintendo and sega master system in the back
Kitch galore, good coffee, and original Nintendo games to play on a tv in a nice veneer wood cabinet.  Grab a stack of 80's inspired bumperstickers for all the x and y generation folks you know!

Omfg this place is perfect in every way. From the 80s explosion decor to the great staff to the expertly drafted drinks to the exacting scientific rigor with which they make a single cup of coffee. Seriously, scales? Beakers? It's like a Japanese tea ceremony. And to top it off they have those amazing little French cookies that are so hard to find. You guys make me want to live here!

This is a great coffee shop for the neighborhood.  I love the 80's - 90s theme with a tons of back to the future, starwars, turtles references. It also has the Back to the Future delorene inside the shop.

Great coffee with comfortable seating.  Large table in the middle for the more studious type.  Free unlimited internet.  I l love the music selection because its upbeat and entertaining but still not distracting and loud like other coffee shops.  also I got a free t-shirt (can't beat that).   You can get cookie crisp in a bowl!!

I'm sure this place will get more crowded with time but I think its a great alternative to Filter or Alliance.

Wormhole, you saved our lives with matcha tea and Super Nintendo video games, when we needed to kill a few hours on a chilly Halloween evening. Rock on back to the future, my friend. (As if you couldn't be adorably vintage enough, your bowls of kids cereal were extra bonus points. Watching grown women eat bowls of  rainbow Fruity Pebbles was smile-inducing.)

Have been looking to try this place out for awhile but it is always packed. No surprise - It rocks! free wi-fi, plenty of electricity, homemade coffee flavors, best lattes I've had so far in Chicago, friendly staff and peoples.
Bathrooms were clean, and ambience of 80s themes with a Delorean including a working? Mr. Fusion.
Be prepared for community seating as this place is crowded most times and you will likely be sitting next to somebody.
Ask your friendly barrista what the best choice is if you are indecisive and you won't go wrong. Great study/hang-out place, great coffee!
Simply the best coffee shop in Wicker Park. The atmos' is undeniably fresh and the baristas are helpful and quite friendly.

UM hell yes.

A+ baristas, generally good music, GREAT coffee, vegan pastries, beautiful people watching, fantastic space, in the heart of wicker park.

Yes wormhole, yes.

Really excellent coffee and amazing chocolate muffins. Friendly service too. As I drank my coffee two adorable little girls were hamming it up by the Delorean while their parents took their picture.  It reminded me of growing up in the video store my dad opened when I was 5. I was charmed.

i liked the decor and im not really into that kind of extreme, like cramped "i have a huge collection of stuff from the 90s" or 80s or whatever thing.  originally came in because we saw that "back to the future" decked out car from the storefront window.  they had some coffee that mightve been called Kenya??  but it was like something with fruity tones and it was pretty good.  we got it for there, so they served it in a chicago rare books bookstore tumblr which was kinda cute i guess.

there was a ton of people there just working on stuff on their laptops.  like a bunch of hipsters on their macs and vaios and one guy even had suspenders on.  ANYWAY coffee was good and the whole atmosphere was superb.  i wanted to get a macaroon too but they were out :(  it was like 5pm.

Ok I admit it, I went because they have a DeLorean DMC-12 tricked out BTF-style.  The coffee is good, the atmosphere is relaxed (though a bit crowded).  All in all a worthwhile spot to check out at least once.

Hands down favorite place in the city for coffee.... I wandered by before it was even open and met James... He let us in so we could gawk over the delorian in the window complete with the flux capacitor.... I instantly knew this was the only coffee house in the city for me...

The staff, Kristen, otter, Kate, Deanna and soon I will know the rest, are fun, knowledgeable and high energy.... Not just because of being in a coffee house either..  

Espresso is pulled properly, has the richest flavor.... I will take wormhole over a bar any day!
My favorite coffee shop in Chicago!! All their speciality drinks are amazing!!!!! And the rice krispie treats are the bomb dot com!!!

This is kind of the best place in the world. I mean, I wish they had more seating, because this place is packed 24/7. I don't think I've gotten a comfy seat in this place, ever, and privacy is a no way.

But they have a pretty solid tea selection, they have soy milk out for your coffee/tea, macarons for snacks, and delicious food from Southport Grocery for eating. Plus, their prices are ridiculously reasonable. Two drinks, two macarons, and a sandwich for $13 in Chicago? Talk about awesome.

I love their ginger pu erh tea, for real. It's the only pu erh I've ever cared about, and it's all because of that strong but not overpowering flavor of ginger. It's kind of amazing.

Not to mention the location. Name for me the other quality coffee shop in Wicker Park. Do it. Where else are you going to go before/after vintage shopping or Christmas gift buying this Winter? No where. Because the only other game in town is the tiny Starbucks at Milwaukee and Damen, and who needs that when you've got someplace as frickin' sweet as Wormhole two blocks away?

I'm so sad I only found this place a few weeks before I moved out of the neighborhood.  It's easily the least-pretentious and best-decorated place on the west side.  Great coffee/tea, lots of space with comfy couches and armchairs, free wifi: everything you need.  I miss thee.

The coffee is nearly addicting. It's so terrifically terrific! The vibe is cool and comfy, the decor is pretty nifty, especially the Delorean (they dont care if you put objects on it and take pictures), and the staff is friendly. Now if they got a frequent coffee card or something like that I'd go there all the time. Awww heck, I'll go anyway.

It is a coffee shop with good coffee. The environment is nice, but there wasn't any seating available. I went a long way to check it out, but it is simply a neat coffee shop that i wont check out again.

I'm still trying to figure out how they got that Delorean in there.  Tres cool in my book.  I love how this place is decked out in the old school (OMG the 80s is considered old school now.  Help me, I'm officially old...)  retro gadgets and stuff.  Staff is super nice and helpful.  I got one of the specialty lattes iced.  Very good and not too sweet like Starbux.  Though the price point was comparable to Starbux, until that janky Starbux on the corner of Milwaukee and Damen gets a Delorean crammed in there, the Wormhole will have my business.

Greeaaaaat! Coffee place just north of the six corners in wicker park. The baristas know their drinks and the peanut butter skoopatroopa was amazing. an outlet at almost every seat and free wifi. plus a delorean in the front window. that alone is enough to get me in the door feed your nerd hunger and your caffeine fix all in the same place.

I love their name -- at first I thought the owner is a physic nerd or something, but than I went it there and oh --  i got it now , it was full with 80's Sci-fi movies posters and -- Ta-da -- they actually displace the old car that was used in the movie " back to the future " . lol

I tried their special citrus flavor mocha -- YUMMY !!

But the place was too crowed and I couldn't sit down and use my laptop .... i ended up went to other cafe across the street , ordered another coffee, and stay there , ha  .

Anyway , i will love to check this place again pretty soon !
This joint would be perfect if it had a wider food selection.  Wait.  What's that?  It's going to start getting sandwiches delivered from the Southport Grocery tomorrow?   YAY!

When you walk into this cafe, don't get distracted. Yes there is a delorean, yes there is sweet memorabilia on the walls, and yes there are intimidating skinny jean clad, tattoo embossed, Mac book armed hipsters littering the place. But trust me, put your blinders on and walk your butt over to that counter and get yourself a latte and an order of mocha puffs.

My review is not dictated by the fact that they fit a car in a cafe (despite how awesome the flux capacitor may be) or that they have comfy couches youre welcome to nap on, free wifi, and the trendiest twenty year olds in the city.

The coffee is damned good, and their unique concoctions of cereal and espresso are so simple and delicious you ask yourself why you didn't think of it.

Ok, now that you've tried the mocha puffs and the vanilla bean latte, LOOK ! A DELOREAN! HOW FREAKING COOL!

I arrived somewhat late in Chicago for an overnight stay and there was no way I was going to stay in Subway/CVS-land in The Loop (Intelligentsia on W Jackson was already closed at *7PM*) : I was going to make it to where I wanted to go in the first place out to Wicker Park and I almost just passed by this place a moment ago. The Wormhole has the decor down, obviously, but aside from that it's got quality lattes (I've had a notch better in Cbus and Mpls) and the rest of the checklist gets filled: nice baristas, music (selection and volume), seating, wi-fi, outlets, clean unisex bathrooms, and of course the clientele. As an observant first time visitor I wasn't crazy about a few drab touches of gentrification along Milwaukee, but I'm sure establishments like this have been and will hold their own right in the neighborhood, which if I happened to live in Chicago this seems to be a top contender for which area to reside in: a must being a great coffee shop or three nearby. Oh yeah, and I think there was a uhh...oh now I remember: a fucking decked out Back to the Future DeLorean sitting atop the restroom entrance.

Cool atmosphere - everything is really fresh and tasty. My only complaint would be that the times I've been in here, it's been difficult to find seats. But I guess that has to do with their popularity!

So what is there to say about Wormhole that hasn't been said already?  Let me give you the breakdown:

1. Amazing, amazing honeybear blossom latte.  I am crazy about honey lattes and this one definitely is the perfect balance of honey, milk, and espresso.  It is subtly sweet and intensely delicious.
2. Tasty chocolate dipped biscotti. Could have been less sweet but for a chocolate-dipped one, what did I really expect?
3. Impressive latte art.
4. The decor is absolutely gorgeous, unique, comfortable, and the pewter color on the walls is beautiful.
5. The gals at the register were very nice. There's nothing that I loathe more than customer service that's more bitter than the coffee.

Visited this place a couple of weeks ago and was really pleased with the overall experience. Excellent video on youtube by the current/ former owner of the place that encouraged me to go.  Wonderful coffee and tea selection. They play a nice variety of music so when I heard some pretty cool hip hop tracks I was sold. Be forewarned, it gets mad busy. If you don't care to saddle up next to someone or sit amongst a group of strangers then go to Wormhole anyway and do it because you need to learn lol.
This place is great.  Coffee's good. Wifi's free.  80s toys abound.

Great coffee, good service. They have a great attention to detail which makes their drinks great. They have a lot of vegan options in terms of food and drinks. It's super nerdy but really great. I've never been disappointed!

A little on the expensive side, but they do some creative things with espresso, to their credit. Nifty 70s/80s atmosphere, complete with a functioning 80s-style Nintendo box with an old TV. They told me it works and people play it from time to time. Plenty of cartridges too. Marble Madness anyone? Star Wars memorabilia and period posters everywhere. Filled with hipsters on Macs. Chairs are hit or miss in terms of comfort.

I give the place 4 stars because the baristas are damn talented.  The coffee is good.  Getting it to go would probably bring a 5 star rating.  ...Especially when you factor in the vegan treats for annoying vegans like me.  But when I get my coffee to stay, I want to give the place 3 stars.  I'm an 80s baby and I love Star Wars and Nintendo as much as the next 80s geek.  But I also like my coffee shops comfortable.  For me, the Wormhole is absolutely NOT comfortable.  The layout is weird and the furniture's kind of uncomfortable, and I think everyone spends more time watching eachother than getting anything done (or maybe that's just me).  I rarely see such amazing latte art with soy milk, but I think from now on I'll just take it to go.

Excellent! Everything on the menu is great - and it comes with a retro video game type set of options. The vanilla latte is my favorite. Stay away from the sweet-potato thing....that is unique, but kind of weird. Great place to study, read, and chill. There is free wifi and lots of space. Comfy, good vibe - I would commute 1 hr to get to Wormhole!

Open for less than three weeks and I am already totally loving it.  Great location, very well defined atmosphere (really awesome), and lots of fun seating areas (each with a different feel).  Metropolis Coffee is great as well as some quality teas.  Highly recommended for getting together with peeps, hanging out on a laptop and a couch, or stopping in for some good options!

5 Stars to Sarah for the best freakin dry cappucino in Chicago.  I am an avid fan of Metropolis coffee (one of the best in the world - i travel a bit) and Sarah at Wormhole is the go-to barista for this.  She is also very cool, confident and sweet.  She is pulling in the best baristas around Chicago like an espresso magnet!  This is a special place.... now if I can just get Le Boulangerie to sell them their croissants it will be a 'get er up 'n goin' heaven-sent place to start my day.
Very cool coffee shop.  Seating indoor and outdoor but unfortunately they don't have a blender of frozen blended coffee drinks

epic coffeeshop win.

the staff was nice.  the decor is 1980s pop culture kitsch awesome (think old lunch boxes, movie posters, a copy of Fireball Island and...oh yeah...a freaking DELOREAN in the store).  the clientele is surprisingly geeky for Wicker Park.  the wi-fi is fast.  you have a choice about whether to sit at a normal chair and table, or on a cozy couch.  they're open until midnight.

and...not only does it have free wi-fi, but it has outlets.  EVERYWHERE.  since the battery life on my netbook stinks, this is important to me.  there are four-outlet clusters placed regularly along the walls, and a huge surge-suppressor power strip at the table.  most wi-fi cafes lack outlets; The Wormhole does not.

the only drawback is that they don't have a lot of food options.  but, you don't go to The Wormhole for food.  you go for coffee, drinks (like the Mexican Coke with real sugar), comfy couches, wi-fi, and the geektastic atmosphere.

i'm in love, and i'll be returning regularly.

This place is awesome. I walked in and instantly fell in love. I felt like I was at home. There is a Nintendo system with Super Mario Bros. and all sorts of other games; If I didn't have to go back to work, I would sit there and play all day. The crew that works the counter is friendly, the espresso is amazing.
Really liked it. Great people watching, and plenty of comfy places to sit.  Cleanest darned restroom I've seen in a coffeehouse! Great coffee and fun music (80's when I was there).

One of the best coffee shops in the city.  Excellent space, music, FANTASTIC coffee, super friendly and skilled baristas.

They also have matcha shots... real ones.  I don't know of anywhere else that even has them.

Seriously, go here, it is awesome.

"Freddo, you broke my heart!" Never did these words make as much sense as they do now. I've been a faithful WH customer for years. They delivered in a way so consistent and, in my judgement, above the competition that you HAD to come back. So WHY would they change the coffee supplier and roaster and WHY, if they did it, would this fact not be made abundantly clear to the customer? A little acidity in a brew can be nice, but who wants to drink flavorless hydrochloric acid? The place is still fine otherwise, and there are reasons to go, but many fewer than before. I don't have the heart to take them down two stars, although I probably should, but old-timers, beware.
What a cool little place!  Back To The Future decorations!  A hole in the wall of coffee shops.  They brew Metropolis, case you're curious.  Do it.

This place has it all, charm, style, and flair, yet quaint, cozy, and friendly.  A revolving selection of great roasters, food items, always a special foody style beverage available, tremendous free internet service, and a fantastic staff.  I don't think it gets much better.

To be as concise as possible:
The baristas are amazingly friendly and seem to actually be enjoying themselves.
I was afraid of the gluten-free cupcake, but it was delicious.  Wish there were more "normal" sweets to choose from along with the vegan/gluten-free options.
Many different types of seating.  Only one real big table + chairs set up, so if you didn't grab one of those six seats, it's mostly fluffy chair or couch seating.  Comfortable, but sometimes not conducive to my work ethic.
Music is good and at a good volume.
Great tasting and unique coffee drinks, vegan friendly pastries, and free wi-fi with comfortable seating and plenty of outlets.  Staff is friendly and this place is open til midnight!

Gotta admit, do love those low tables. Wish there were more than two. pbj, cereal, easy-going good lookin staff, beat up couches...nice place to read a book after a long day...open the latest of all the coffeehouses in the neighborhood.

Stopped in and was pleasantly surprised to find pastries from Fritz. Note to vegans, the donuts and muffins are vegan! Best vegan donut I've had, and glad to have Fritz pastries closer to home than the actual Fritz shop. Prices were good and they had day old muffins sitting out for free. I don't know if that's a regular thing, but i hope so because it's a great idea.

I'm an iced americano kinda girl and they do serve the best one in wicker park. Typically when i go into any coffee shop I get a scone, cookie, or tea cakes. I would recommend the pistachio teacakes or the amazing chocolate-pretzel cookie. The price isn't bad if you just have a coffee but if you add any goodies your pocketbook might feel it. Like typically $10-12 including tip. But the decorations can't be beat. Is it bad that i want to steal the Delorean every time i go in there?

Okay so this place is so awesome - I could go on FOREVER.
The coffee, drinks, baristas,food, decor - all super fantastic.

So why the 4 stars and not 5?

I have gone in there every day if not every other day since the exact day they opened. Literally. And not not once has anyone ever recognized my face, cared to ask my name, said welcome back, anything - its like I don't exist.

Also - the serving sizes for drinks is really small and it kinda bites. But the drinks are so good it almost overrides their shrimpy size.

They make killer drinks, a great egg salad sandwich (again Ive eaten that for lunch, sometimes every single day I work for 5 days straight)  and yet when I order it the guy asks me "Have you ever had one before? They're very rich."

It kills me that I love it so much..... I just want to be loved back.  One day I came in for breakfast, lunch, and dinner - literally. Nothin.

Always great service, always fantastic drinks, killer decor, great location free wifi.  YES.

Maybe because it was my first time there... the menu had very little, I wasn't sure what the many other types of coffee were. The types of tea were clearly listed however and easy to maneuver around. Very cool decorations and furniture. I'll definitely stop by if I'm in the area. Love how eco-friendly the place is but I don't know if I'll venture all the way there just for a cup of coffee.
I'm pretty sure The Wormhole is the best cafe in Chicago. The drinks are creative and tasty-- I'm a fan of the Bedrock and Peanut Butter Koopa Troopa.

I've tried this place a few times on the quest for convenient coffee shops in which to get work done. First, the good: The baristas are always very nice and the $1 macarons are good, and if you stay until close they put the unsold pastries out on the counter for free (I overheard staff telling someone else, they didn't tell me probably because by the time I left I was so cranky they didn't want me to have their freebies.) Tea and coffee are alright. And I guess the 80s-throwback decor appeals to a lot of people though it seems hopelessly kitschy and ironic in the annoying hipster way (though, if they did a whole coffee shop of 70s-era Harrison Ford posters I would not be complaining). I think the Delorean takes up a lot of space, and as the place is packed it can be a bit frustrating when a car takes a place you could be sitting. The sandwiches look stale and boring, and I had the chai cereal once which was ok but still, cereal, so therefore it pained me to spend $3 or whatever for it. My big complaint is that it's too loud here. I know, I know, I sound like such an old woman, but even in the evenings most people here are having small conversations or working on laptops, and even when I wore headphones I couldn't drown out entire albums of The Ramones or Dr Dre or whatever. All in all, due to major annoyance with this place, I'll be taking it off my list as an alternative to Filter.

absolutely amazing coffee. i am not sure if it's the coffee they use or just how they make it, but it literally stopped and made me think about coffee in a way i don't do unless it's intelligensia. the staff is super nice (not pretentious). it's not wailing loud with obnoxious music if you want to read or work, but it's not insanely quiet either. they have a deloriean in the front window a la back to the future so on initial impression i think i thought they were trying too hard. the fact that it's in wicker park prolly added to my pre-judging, but they won me over HARD. love the comfy couches and the 2D nintendo games. can't wait to go back. they also appeared to have fairly beautiful food--small sandwiches and the like. check it out.

I really like the pour overs and coffee drinks here but I will say that one of it's downfalls is that it often does not have seats indoor or out free..it's a very popular place but it's also one of those places where people sit down for hours on one cup of coffee playing video games or with their laptops which makes it harder to meet friends there.  If you are just getting coffee to go, this is a good bet but if you want to meet someone, come at non peak hours or you'll probably be out of luck.  This place gets plus kitsch points, points for clean bathrooms, quality of music playing is somewhat spotty (sometimes I've heard The Black Angels but other times it is general 80s music like you'd hear in some of the films they have posters for on the walls.)  You can't beat a coffee shop that has a Delorean and Gremlin collectables but I do wish it was a touch larger inside and/or that people were didn't sit in their cozy spots for hours even when others were waiting.

really nice atmosphere. busy, but not loud, dim lighting and the delorean in the window is pretty rad. the employees were really friendly and my coffee was delicious. they brew ritual beans; it was nice to have a little taste of home when i'm out of town. if you're familiar with san francisco, it's like the chicago version of sugarlump on 24th ... but BETTER.
I wish it wasn't so crowded but understand why it is!  Obviously I can't get enough of the '80s theme, which is amazing, and the coffee is delish and beautiful!  Get a latte!
ugh. i wish this place was in logan square instead. that's how much this place is needed all over the city.

The wormhole is so cozy and comfortable and I love the staff. They are super friendly and not coffee-shop-snotty and there's a DeLorean in this place. I am addicted to their macaroons! There's also Nintendo! Go here!

I stopped in here for the first time after going to my bank across the street.  I'd been dying for a cup of coffee all morning and had completely forgotten about this place.  I ordered a small latte and was surprised when, after just a few sips, I had decided that this was probably THE BEST cup of coffee I had ever had.  Ever.  Yes, it takes a while to make, the line gets kinda long, but if every cup is as good as that first one, I will be going there for life. I'm excited to go there with some friends and try some of their specialty drinks.
Stopped into this place while running errands for a quick coffee to go. Delicious coffee, friendly staff, good price, fantastic decor ... what more can you ask for from a coffee shop?
outstanding place to get an amazing latte and catch up on some light reading.  if you enjoy low key, intelligent and artistic people this is the place for you
Wormhole Coffee has its specialty. Baristas are super friendly, while their coffee is superb. Boba cannot be missed no matter what.

My new favorite coffee shop, by far. There are three places closer to my house than Wormhole, but I'll bike the extra ten blocks for their amazing cold-brew iced coffee, delicious muffins and doughnuts (vegan! though you'd never guess), and rad music that's always exactly what I want to hear on the sound system. There's tons of comfortable seating, plus everyone who works there is always so cheerful and polite. I've seen them deal with difficult orders and panhandling at the door, and they handle everything with a smile. I'm so glad this place opened, it's the best coffee shop in miles.

Another great independent coffee shop! The employees are ridiculously friendly and kind. The baristas know what they're doing and they offer a pretty good variety of coffee and teas (pastries are great too). The large interior is extremely well decorated with many unique and vintage items. A downside might be that they attract many sickeningly "hip" customers, but that isn't their fault.

The most chill coffee shop I've ever been to, great seating options from tables to couches and the customers are way trendy/hipster if you're worried about fitting in. oh yeah and if you love the 80s there's tons of it here (minus the music)

I love this place. The drinks are excellently brewed and always delicious. The service is wonderful. I was here once when the espresso machine was malfunctioning. Instead of serving gross espresso, they gave out cards for a free drink. I was in today and somehow my order got lost in the shuffle. I came up to the counter, and they tried to take my order. I pointed out that I had already ordered and paid. The guy at the counter promptly apologized and gave me a card for a free drink (any free drink, not just a small coffee) and started making my  drink, no hassle. The coffee is amazing, the service is great, and the decor is kitschy to the extreme. It can be a little crowded, so I usually take my coffee to go.
Too small, too crowded, atmosphere is too busy to concentrate and too trendy. If you're looking for a "cool, trendy hot spot" this is it. I was just looking for a quiet place to study.
awesome coffee and an awesome place to hang out and get shit done, especially if you work "from home" like yours truly. i spend hours in there every week.
soy chai latte in contention for my second best :)

At last the uber-cool wormhole has opened in Wicker Park. The only thing rarer in Chicago than coffee shops that pull espresso at the level of the perfect beauty I had today, are coffee shops with Deloreans parked in the front window. If you are serious about coffee you must check out this place as they have it going on at the highest level. Even if coffee isn't your thing and you just want a fun and hip place to hang the Wormhole belongs on your list. The Chicago coffee scene is making huge strides forward in recent months and The Wormhole is a welcome addition.

love the ambiance!
love the drip coffee! (deep but not bitter, "clean" after taste)
macaroons--try them all! (at closing, he sent us home with the leftovers! what a doll!)
really chill and sweet baristas!
a must go-to cafe!
The coffee was good, not great.  I felt a little out of place but I would still probably go back if I was in a crunch because it was so close to my apartment.
Best coffee in the city.   The pastries rock too.

I really liked this place! Eric the barista was incredibly friendly and took the time to dial in a great shot of a coffee they typically only use for drip. The decor is funky without a hint of pretentiousness. Excellent cafe!
